column4: Abbie Moon Is 18 Today Handicap
column19: Placed over 11.6f here on his recent Flat handicap debut, GREGORIANS STAR could have untapped potential over today's much longer trip.
column20: 2/1 Rupert The Prince, 4/1 Star Of Jupiter, 9/2 Gregorians Star, 6/1 Somebodycomegether, 7/1 Wannabeawallaby, 10/1 Girl Of Gold, 20/1 Endofastorm,  Ridgemaster, 25/1 Abstract, 33/1 Sobegrand, 40/1 Sky Dancer,  Uther Pendragon, 50/1 Izakaya,  Godstone
column36: Badly out of form last year; returns from 446-day absence with a lot to prove
column37: Won over hurdles for a different stable in summer 2023 but was badly out of form on the Flat for this yard last year and returns from 446-day absence with a lot to prove.

column4: Abbie Moon Is 18 Today Handicap
column19: Placed over 11.6f here on his recent Flat handicap debut, GREGORIANS STAR could have untapped potential over today's much longer trip.
column20: 2/1 Rupert The Prince, 4/1 Star Of Jupiter, 9/2 Gregorians Star, 6/1 Somebodycomegether, 7/1 Wannabeawallaby, 10/1 Girl Of Gold, 20/1 Endofastorm,  Ridgemaster, 25/1 Abstract, 33/1 Sobegrand, 40/1 Sky Dancer,  Uther Pendragon, 50/1 Izakaya,  Godstone
column36: Recently placed over 11.6f here on heavy ground; big player if this new trip suits
column37: Bumper winner who was placed on the last two of his five Flat starts, more recently when third in handicap here (11.6f, heavy) ten days ago; could easily have more to offer over today's longer trip; big player.

column4: Abbie Moon Is 18 Today Handicap
column19: Placed over 11.6f here on his recent Flat handicap debut, GREGORIANS STAR could have untapped potential over today's much longer trip.
column20: 2/1 Rupert The Prince, 4/1 Star Of Jupiter, 9/2 Gregorians Star, 6/1 Somebodycomegether, 7/1 Wannabeawallaby, 10/1 Girl Of Gold, 20/1 Endofastorm,  Ridgemaster, 25/1 Abstract, 33/1 Sobegrand, 40/1 Sky Dancer,  Uther Pendragon, 50/1 Izakaya,  Godstone
column36: 0-13 under all codes but was denied clear run when third at Redcar last time; shortlisted
column37: 0-13 under all codes but was denied clear run before keeping on well for third on Flat return at Redcar (2m, good to soft) in July and has travelled from North Yorkshire for this race (trainer's first runner here).

column4: Abbie Moon Is 18 Today Handicap
column19: Placed over 11.6f here on his recent Flat handicap debut, GREGORIANS STAR could have untapped potential over today's much longer trip.
column20: 2/1 Rupert The Prince, 4/1 Star Of Jupiter, 9/2 Gregorians Star, 6/1 Somebodycomegether, 7/1 Wannabeawallaby, 10/1 Girl Of Gold, 20/1 Endofastorm,  Ridgemaster, 25/1 Abstract, 33/1 Sobegrand, 40/1 Sky Dancer,  Uther Pendragon, 50/1 Izakaya,  Godstone
column36: Latest run was slightly more encouraging be she has basically been out of form this summer
column37: Took small step back in right direction when fourth of seven here (1m5f, firm) last month but has basically been out of form this summer; sports refitted cheekpieces today; seems versatile ground-wise; others preferred.

column27: Skymarc Farm & Haras De La Fontaine
column36: Maiden in France and Britain; needs to improve for a hood being added and the new trip
column37: Placed four times at up to 1m3f in France; missed all of 2024 and ran as well as could be expected when fifth at Chepstow (1m2f, good) in June for new yard; no improvement on that when a one-paced fourth on Chelmsford AW since and now has a hood added; needs to improve for it and the new trip.

column19: Most have a query but MRS MEADER showed signs of life last time and is taken to repeat her 2024 win, which came off a 2lb higher mark.

column36: Minor hurdle form off modest marks but might have more going for her back on the Flat
column37: Hasn't gone on off modest marks over hurdles but perhaps the Flat is more her calling, having had limited opportunities but running well when second of 11 at Nottingham (1m2f, good) in May 2024; hard to be sure she's in much form, though.

column32: R Greenwood & John And Peter Seabrook
column36: Won on soft last autumn but a slog this year; not ruled out after the recent rain though
column37: Two wins in 2024, over 1m4f (AW) and 1m2f (soft), but it's been a slog this year and he's gone into reverse since a better effort in third of 11 at Windsor (1m2f, soft) in July; the recent rain is in his favour now back on turf, though, and he's not ruled out.

column36: Some AW promise in Ireland; placed hurdle form of late; career-low mark back on Flat
column37: Some AW promise in Ireland early in 2024 but she didn't make the grade in handicaps and her placed form over hurdles has settled into an ordinary groove; career-low mark back on the Flat but it may have further to fall.

column36: Maiden; up and down but capable at 1m4f on his day and handles soft ground
column37: Maiden who has his good and moderate days but he's capable off his current mark and testing ground hasn't been a problem in the past; probably better for the run when returning from a break last week and comes into it on a second of nine at Haydock (1m4f, good) under Megan Jordan in May.

column36: Signs of revival latest and 2lb lower than when winning this last year; has won on heavy
column37: Handful of starts this year, not showing much until Chelmsford recently, when beaten only by one who'd dropped a long way in the weights; comes here in better form than when winning this race last year and good chance of another win now 2lb lower; has won on heavy.

column37: Five turf wins, most recently at Ffos Las (1m6f, good to soft; other wins on good or quicker) in July 2024; suffered two heavy defeats this year but refitting regular cheekpieces could make a difference.

column37: No strong going preferences and he's been in good form over shorter trips (1m2f and 1m) on last two starts; however, he has a major stamina query going beyond 1m2f for the first time.

column36: Promising 3rd on handicap debut (1m1f, AW) but poor results since and risky again
column37: Improved on earlier form when third of ten on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f, AW) in January but has finished remote since, in a hood then cheekpieces (retained) on last two starts; risky.

column37: Hooded all three runs; third at Kempton (6f, AW) and Glorious Goodwood (7f, good) on first two starts, front-running in the latter and his best form; raced too freely in front at Epsom (7f, good) on latest outing, hanging left and turned over at 1-3, but even that gives him leading form claims.

column37: 33-1, soon behind when tailed off in a novice at Thirsk (7f, good to firm) four weeks ago.

column37: Similar placed form when favourite at Newmarket (6f, good to firm; slowly away) and Ascot (6f, good; always prominent); there's stamina on the dam's side and she has strong each-way claims again.

column36: 18-1 at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) but always in touch and kept on stoutly for 3rd of 10
column37: £65,000 breeze-up 2yo by Ardad; 18-1 in novice at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) three weeks ago but always in touch and kept on stoutly for third of ten; should improve and have a major say.

column36: 25-1, unable to get competitive when 7th of nine in Lingfield maiden (5f, good) in June
column37: 25-1, unable to get competitive when seventh of nine in Lingfield maiden (5f, good) in June, showing low-level form; late foal and upped 2f.

column36: Close third of five here (7.6f) but beaten nearly 10l at Newmarket (7f) 12 days later
column37: Close third of five here (7.6f, good to firm) early last month was a bright start but going down by nearly 10l at Newmarket (7f, good to firm) 12 days later seemingly puts a dampener on her prospects.

column36: 10,000gns yearling by Territories; trainer has had two 2yo debut winners this season
column37: 10,000gns yearling; seventh foal; Territories half-sister to 5f/6f winner Spanish Angel (including 2yo; RPR 85); dam placed at 7.6f/1m as 2yo (64), out of maiden half-sister to 7f Group 3 winner Wake Up Maggie; trainer has had two 2yo winners this season, both first time out (28-1 and 9-1).

column36: Tasleet filly; yard has few 2yo runners
column37: Tasleet filly; fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to 5.4f 2yo winner English Hero, out of maiden half-sister to useful 5f/6f winner Englishman; yard has few 2yo runners.

column4: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
column19: There's a question over Hamish on ground not softer than good. Similar could apply to MILITARY ACADEMY but he's the big form threat.
column20: 10/11 Hamish, 7/2 Military Academy, 11/2 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Mount Atlas, 14/1 Grey Cuban, 33/1 Champagne Prince
column36: Distinguished career includes two wins here; turf runs last six years on softer than good
column37: 9yo who's won a hatful of Group 3s over 1m4f-1m6f in his long and distinguished career, including two Ormondes over the extended 1m5f here; also won 1m4f Listed races at the Curragh (yielding) last November and Goodwood (soft; by a neck from Military Academy at level weights) this June, which were his last two outings; all of his turf starts in the last six years have been on softer than good, so rain may be needed.

column4: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
column19: There's a question over Hamish on ground not softer than good. Similar could apply to MILITARY ACADEMY but he's the big form threat.
column20: 10/11 Hamish, 7/2 Military Academy, 11/2 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Mount Atlas, 14/1 Grey Cuban, 33/1 Champagne Prince
column36: Best form on AW, on which he's 5-7 (including a 1m4f Listed win) whereas 0-8 on turf
column37: Best form on AW, on which he's 5-7 (including a 1m4f Listed win from the front last December) whereas 0-8 on turf; has shown easily his best turf form in two of his last three starts (gelded before latest) but much better is seemingly required today.

column4: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
column19: There's a question over Hamish on ground not softer than good. Similar could apply to MILITARY ACADEMY but he's the big form threat.
column20: 10/11 Hamish, 7/2 Military Academy, 11/2 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Mount Atlas, 14/1 Grey Cuban, 33/1 Champagne Prince
column36: Tailed off last two runs; better seems likely on return to Chester but stamina is in doubt
column37: This course rather dominates his turf record, most notably with a big career best to win 1m2f handicap in July in good style from the front; the scale of his defeats at other tracks on his last two outings is a concern and although better seems likely on this return to Chester, stamina is in doubt.

column4: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
column19: There's a question over Hamish on ground not softer than good. Similar could apply to MILITARY ACADEMY but he's the big form threat.
column20: 10/11 Hamish, 7/2 Military Academy, 11/2 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Mount Atlas, 14/1 Grey Cuban, 33/1 Champagne Prince
column36: Neck 2nd to Hamish when level weights at Goodwood (1m4f, soft) is easily best turf form
column37: 3-4 last term, notably with a 1m4f Listed success on AW; cheekpieces have gone on this season, with two solid seconds and the modest shows on his other two starts (Bahrain and the Goodwood Cup) can probably be forgiven; going down by a neck to Hamish when level weights in Listed race at Goodwood (1m4f, soft) was easily his best turf form and gives him a big shout.

column4: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
column19: There's a question over Hamish on ground not softer than good. Similar could apply to MILITARY ACADEMY but he's the big form threat.
column20: 10/11 Hamish, 7/2 Military Academy, 11/2 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Mount Atlas, 14/1 Grey Cuban, 33/1 Champagne Prince
column36: Needs better and also to bounce back from a shocker (front-running was blamed) at York
column37: Progressive in 2024 and better still this term, winning tidily in a six-runner handicap at Ascot (1m4f, good to firm; acts on good to soft) in July; appeared to run well when fifth of six in Group 3 here in May but better is needed to win this and he needs to bounce back from a shocker at York (front-running was blamed) three weeks ago.

column4: Virgin Bet Stand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
column19: There's a question over Hamish on ground not softer than good. Similar could apply to MILITARY ACADEMY but he's the big form threat.
column20: 10/11 Hamish, 7/2 Military Academy, 11/2 Sir Dinadan, 7/1 Mount Atlas, 14/1 Grey Cuban, 33/1 Champagne Prince
column36: Irish Derby 5th is well ahead of his other ratings; needs a second look back down in class
column37: 40-1 fifth in the Irish Derby at the Curragh (1m4f, good) in June, front rank long way; it's a concern that his rating that day is well in advance of his others, and also that he was beaten so far in the storm at Glorious Goodwood on latest outing, but he needs a second look back down in class.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: Won a slowly run, 2m Group 3 at Ascot in April; behind in tough assignments since
column37: Given wind surgery and tongue tied for new connections this season, which he started with a bang when winning a slowly run, four-runner Group 3 at Ascot (2m, good to firm) in April; remote since, however, in the Gold Cup there, a French Group 2 and the Ebor at York; this is a lesser handicap but he does not inspire great confidence even so.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: While peak 2024 efforts give him a fine chance, some caution is currently advised
column37: Pulled up in Saudi Arabia in February (heart issue) and well held in two British handicaps since; closer in Listed race here (first visit) on latest start but he was only fifth of six in that slowly run race; while peak 2024 efforts give him a fine chance, some caution is currently advised.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: Second, first and third in the last three Chester Cups; trouble sustaining his form though
column37: Second, first and third in the last three Chester Cups; he didn't quite reproduce that form in the 2023 or 2024 campaigns, however, and tailed off at Royal Ascot on first attempt this season; comfortably held in fourth in this race last year; this does not look the time to catch him.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: Two C&D wins this stage last year, including this race; won Northumberland Plate this June
column37: While his peak form was in 2022, he won twice over C&D at this stage last year (including this race by a nose) and was 25-1 winner of the Northumberland Plate at Newcastle (2m, AW) this June; fair efforts on last two starts; needs respect as each-way candidate.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: Finally broke his British duck at Southwell (2m, AW; from Artisan Dancer) 16 days ago
column37: Three wins in France (2023); tailed off on sole start here in this race last year; finally broke his British duck at Southwell (2m, AW; from Artisan Dancer) 16 days ago and some 2025 turf form wasn't far behind it, but he's back up 3lb and seemingly needs to find a bit extra.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: Never better as hurdler; 2m4f might have stretched him at Royal Ascot 2024; respected
column37: Second past post in the very valuable Galway Hurdle (2m, good) six weeks ago but awarded it due to interference; that followed his second in the County Hurdle at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) in March; he's never been better in that sphere and shaped a bit better than seventh might suggest at Royal Ascot 2024 when 2m4f might have stretched him; back to Flat but respected.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.

column36: Chance judged on his peak efforts on AW or good to firm, the latest a 1m6f win in June
column37: Hooded last four starts; chance judged on his peak efforts on AW or good to firm, the latest being his 1m6f win at Sandown in June; there's a bit more to prove away from that ground and after his three attempts at 2m+.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)

column32: Dooley T'breds, J Fairhurst, Kabin Racing Synd, N O'Hare
column36: Running well at 1m2f-2m on AW but his only two appearances on turf this season were poor
column37: Twice second in the spring, plus fourth in the Northumberland Plate at Newcastle (2m, AW) and a 1m2f AW win at Dundalk on latest outing; however, his only two appearances on turf this season were poor.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)

column27: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
column36: Second to Sheradann at Southwell 16 days ago and beaten a nose at York last Sunday
column37: Usually held up; below form on worse than good to soft; third to Gibside in the Chester Plate in May on his only race at this track, having won at Ripon the time before; that's his latest win but he's been bang there in a string of races, including when second to Sheradann at Southwell 16 days ago and beaten a nose off this mark at York last Sunday; leading contender.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Ndaawi is a deservedly high-profile candidate but GIBSIDE could flower again, returning to the scene of his win in May.
column20: 11/4 Ndaawi, 5/1 Spirit Mixer, 11/2 Artisan Dancer, 7/1 Zoffee, 8/1 Sheradann, 9/1 Tribal Star, 10/1 Prydwen, 14/1 Youthful King, 20/1 Yashin,  Gibside,  Sixpack, 50/1 Torcello
column36: 11yo; softer than good (preferably soft or heavy) has suited him best for a long time now
column37: Sixth in 2022 Chester Cup (sole visit); well handicapped on best 2024 form; now an 11yo, well beaten on final outing last season and his only start this term (June); the latter was on good ground, whereas it's softer (preferably soft or heavy) which has suited him best for a long time now.

column4: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Watergate Cup (Heritage Handicap) (GBBPlus Race)

column37: Unraced at Group level but looks highly progressive after finishing well on top in a valuable conditions race over Deauville's extended 6f (soft) a month ago (the second has since won a handicap); quotes would suggest he's held in high regard by powerful connections and dangerous to pass over here, especially should it get wet.

column36: It was never in much doubt under a prominent ride in winning the Group 3 Acomb at York
column37: Both runs over 7f on good to firm; looked very nice when overcoming signs of inexperience at Newbury and confirmed that promise in winning the Group 3 Acomb at York, a race that the yard's future 2,000 Guineas winner Chaldean also won en route to taking this and the Dewhurst; likeably straightforward and it was never in much doubt last time after he raced close to the pace throughout; hard to knock.

column36: Fifth in a strong maiden on debut before coasting home in front by 8l at Sandown; exciting
column37: Frankel colt; caught on the wing when fifth in a traditionally strong maiden at Newmarket's July festival, the form of which could barely have worked out better; duly built on that when coasting home in front by 8l at Sandown (7f, good), in the process posting smart closing fractions; has the size and scope to keep improving and he's an exciting prospect.

column37: Only two wins from 26 attempts but he arrives here in top form after recent thirds at Goodwood (6f Stewards' Cup) and Ascot (5f); this intermediate distance ought to be ideal and he should be in the thick of things again in first-time cheekpieces.

column32: Roddy O Byrne And Robert O Byrne
column36: 2-2 at Doncaster, namely soft-ground wins in 2023 and 2024; interesting back here
column37: Best effort this term when second to Quinault at York (7f, good) on penultimate start; 2-2 at Doncaster, namely soft-ground wins in the sales race at this meeting in 2023 and Listed event last November; interesting back here, assuming he takes well to first-time headgear.

column4: Betfred Park Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Back at Doncaster, ROOM SERVICE is an interesting alternative to top-rated Shadow Of Light. Ten Bob Tony has good claims.
column20: 13/8 Shadow Of Light, 9/2 Ten Bob Tony, 6/1 Marvelman, 7/1 Room Service, 11/1 King's Gamble, 12/1 Quinault, 16/1 Audience,  East Hampton, 25/1 Devil's Point,  Zoum Zoum, 50/1 Zabeel Alkabeir
column36: Gelded prior to Group 3 win at Haydock in sole run this term; may progress further
column37: Gelded prior to narrow success in the John of Gaunt at Haydock (good; Group 3) in sole run this season, producing a career-best performance and taking record over 7f to 3-7; acts on soft; this 4yo goes well fresh and may be capable of further progress; respected.

column4: Betfred Park Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Back at Doncaster, ROOM SERVICE is an interesting alternative to top-rated Shadow Of Light. Ten Bob Tony has good claims.
column20: 13/8 Shadow Of Light, 9/2 Ten Bob Tony, 6/1 Marvelman, 7/1 Room Service, 11/1 King's Gamble, 12/1 Quinault, 16/1 Audience,  East Hampton, 25/1 Devil's Point,  Zoum Zoum, 50/1 Zabeel Alkabeir
column36: Returns to the scene of his last success but this is a stiffer assignment
column37: Ran well in Listed grade at Salisbury on reappearance; has failed to repeat that form in two major handicaps at Ascot since; returns to the scene of his last success (6f, soft) but this is a stiffer assignment.

column4: Betfred Park Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Back at Doncaster, ROOM SERVICE is an interesting alternative to top-rated Shadow Of Light. Ten Bob Tony has good claims.
column20: 13/8 Shadow Of Light, 9/2 Ten Bob Tony, 6/1 Marvelman, 7/1 Room Service, 11/1 King's Gamble, 12/1 Quinault, 16/1 Audience,  East Hampton, 25/1 Devil's Point,  Zoum Zoum, 50/1 Zabeel Alkabeir
column27: Manor Farm Stud & J E Rose
column36: Interesting on penultimate effort when second behind the subsequent Group 1 Marois winner
column37: Irish challenger; has something to find on most of his form but he is interesting judged on penultimate effort, when close second in Group 2 at the Curragh (7f, good to yielding) behind Diego Velazquez who followed up in the Group 1 Marois; that's his clear peak on RPRs.

column4: Betfred Park Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Back at Doncaster, ROOM SERVICE is an interesting alternative to top-rated Shadow Of Light. Ten Bob Tony has good claims.
column20: 13/8 Shadow Of Light, 9/2 Ten Bob Tony, 6/1 Marvelman, 7/1 Room Service, 11/1 King's Gamble, 12/1 Quinault, 16/1 Audience,  East Hampton, 25/1 Devil's Point,  Zoum Zoum, 50/1 Zabeel Alkabeir
column36: 0-7 on turf but was a good third in the Hungerford last time; enters calculations
column37: Record of 1-1 on AW compared to 0-7 on turf; however, he has two pieces of very useful form in this sphere, including third in the Hungerford at Newbury (7f, good to firm; Group 2) last time; enters calculations, having shown there's possibly a race of this nature in him.

column4: Betfred Park Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Back at Doncaster, ROOM SERVICE is an interesting alternative to top-rated Shadow Of Light. Ten Bob Tony has good claims.
column20: 13/8 Shadow Of Light, 9/2 Ten Bob Tony, 6/1 Marvelman, 7/1 Room Service, 11/1 King's Gamble, 12/1 Quinault, 16/1 Audience,  East Hampton, 25/1 Devil's Point,  Zoum Zoum, 50/1 Zabeel Alkabeir
column36: Champion 2yo last term; drops back from Group 1 level with leading claims on best form
column37: Champion 2yo last season, having won the Middle Park and Dewhurst (both on soft ground), and he ran well in the 2,000 Guineas on reappearance; rather a disappointing favourite in the 6f Commonwealth Cup, then couldn't quite get the job done in the 7f Prix Jean Prat having held every chance; drops back from Group 1 level with leading claims on best form.

column4: Betfred Park Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Back at Doncaster, ROOM SERVICE is an interesting alternative to top-rated Shadow Of Light. Ten Bob Tony has good claims.
column20: 13/8 Shadow Of Light, 9/2 Ten Bob Tony, 6/1 Marvelman, 7/1 Room Service, 11/1 King's Gamble, 12/1 Quinault, 16/1 Audience,  East Hampton, 25/1 Devil's Point,  Zoum Zoum, 50/1 Zabeel Alkabeir
column36: Promising debut win at Lingfield six weeks ago but he has loads to find on that form
column37: Wootton Bassett colt who made a promising start to his career with ready win at Lingfield (7f, good) six weeks ago; open to progress but that form gives him loads to find upped markedly in class.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column36: Won 1m6f Group 2 Queen's Vase and staying-on second in the 1m4f Great Voltigeur at York
column37: Blinkered all starts, none on softer than good; won his first three races, culminating in 1m6f Group 2 Queen's Vase at Royal Ascot by three quarters of a length from Furthur; off two months before the Great Voltigeur at York (down to 1m4f) in which he lost his unbeaten record but showed further improved form, outpaced in behind horses before rallying strongly when switched, prevailing in a photo for second which also involved Stay True; that suggests better still is likely on today's step back up in trip; player.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column36: Second in the 1m6f Queen's Vase and impressive in the 13.2f Geoffrey Freer at Newbury
column37: All this season's races have been on good or firmer; second in the 1m6f Group 2 Queen's Vase at Royal Ascot, on the heels of Carmers; flopped behind Scandinavia at Newmarket three weeks later but resumed his improvement to win the Group 3 Geoffrey Freer at Newbury (13.2f) four weeks ago, coming from almost last to first in a steadily run, six-runner race to score by 3l; better still is required but that win was delivered in good style.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column32: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
column36: Form pick after two Derby wins which shouted stamina; may have needed his Voltigeur run
column37: Set the pace when winning the Derby at Epsom by nearly 4l and helped to set it when he dug deep to follow up in Irish Derby at the Curragh (again 1m4f on good) later in June; 3l fifth when 4-5 in the Great Voltigeur at York last month looked disappointing, notwithstanding the sprint from early in the straight, but his trainer has stressed that it was a stepping stone to bigger prizes in the autumn; the two Derby wins suggest this trip won't be a problem and they are the best form in this field.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column36: Backward step last time is forgivable; bang there with three of these in Queen's Vase
column37: Progressive first five races, finishing bang there with Carmers, Furthur and Scandinavia when third in the Queen's Vase at Royal Ascot and he came from significantly further back than the first two; that's his only attempt at 1m6f and he took his first backward step when fourth in the storm at Goodwood (1m4f Group 3) on latest outing; that can probably be forgiven but he needs to resume his progress.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column32: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
column36: Much better with cheekpieces on to win 1m5f Group 3 at Newmarket and the 2m Goodwood Cup
column37: Plenty went wrong for him racing wide in the 1m6f Queen's Vase at Royal Ascot but he rallied strongly for a close fifth, just behind three of today's rivals; much better with cheekpieces since, winning a five-runner Group 3 at Newmarket (1m5f) by nearly 9l and outgunning his older stablemate Illinois in their duel for the Goodwood Cup (2m, good); that makes him look the strongest stayer in this field and gives him almost the best form.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column32: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
column36: Threatened to win Great Voltigeur, a run his trainer says was needed; exciting prospect
column37: Three of Aidan O'Brien's last four St Leger winners were by Galileo and this colt is from the great sire's final crop; unraced on softer than good; won a 1m2f Leopardstown maiden and short-headed in 11.6f Lingfield Derby Trial; off for more than three months before he upstaged stablemate Lambourn in the 1m4f Great Voltigeur at York, taking over briefly more than 1f out, and although he finished fourth he was pipped for second only on the line by Carmers; there's more for him to prove regarding stamina today compared to all of his rivals, but O'Brien made clear that the York race was needed; after just three races, he still looks an exciting prospect.

column4: Betfred St Leger Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
column19: Lambourn and SCANDINAVIA stand out from the rest on their best form. Stay True is fascinating but Carmers is second choice.
column20: 6/4 Scandinavia, 11/4 Lambourn, 9/2 Carmers, 8/1 Stay True, 11/1 Furthur, 22/1 Tarriance, 25/1 Rahiebb
column36: Two battling 1m6f handicap wins; promising stayer but the St Leger is much more demanding
column37: Five races and highly progressive, winning three; penultimate start saw him take a handicap at Sandown (1m6f, good) from Pendragon, whose next race saw him take second in yesterday's Doncaster Cup; latest start was the prestigious Melrose Handicap at York (1m6f, good to firm) in which his battling qualities were again strongly in evidence and he won on the nod; a promising stayer, for sure, and that's twice he's pulled it out of the fire but the St Leger is a much more demanding task.

column36: Promising start when close second of five at Newmarket; plenty of improvement possible
column37: 850,000euros yearling, by Camelot out of a German Oaks winner; promising start when a close second of five at Newmarket (1m, good to firm; 11-8 favourite) four weeks ago, doing his best work late on after a slow start; the hood is retained today and plenty of improvement is possible; big chance.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column37: Fared best of the newcomers when third of seven at Lingfield (1m, AW; 9-1) last month, never far away; his stable's 2yos often make a big step forward from debut to second run, and he has to be respected.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column36: Bred to be smart but too green to do himself justice on debut; should do much better
column37: Bred to be smart (by Dubawi out of a French 12.5f Group 2 winner) but was too green to do himself justice when ninth of 16 at Newbury (7f, good to firm; 11-2) in July; almost certainly capable of much better.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column27: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Ecurie Melanie &
column36: Showed something to build on when fourth of ten at Sandown; not discounted
column37: Showed something to build on when around 3l fourth of ten at Sandown (7f, soft; 9-1) two weeks ago, rallying; shapes as if this longer trip will suit; not discounted.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column27: Macquaire Blds / Lynch Bages / Tim Hyde
column36: Kept on well towards finish when third at Newbury; commands major respect for top yard
column37: Kept on well towards the finish when third of ten at Newbury (7f, good to firm; 16-1) last month, giving the impression this step up in distance would be right up his street; top stable has won two of the last three runnings of this race; commands major respect.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column36: Has an attractive pedigree; yard is operating at impressive 31% with its 2yos this season
column37: By Iffraaj out of 7f 2yo winning sister to smart 1m-1m2f winner Electrical Storm and half-sister to multiple 1m Group 1 winner Ribchester; that's an attractive pedigree and his yard, which won this race in 2020, is operating at an impressive 31% with its 2yos this season; interesting newcomer.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column36: 150,000gns yearling by Zarak; worth a market check on debut
column37: 90,000euros foal, 150,000gns yearling; by Zarak; dam unraced sister to winners Goken (5f/5.5f Group 3) and Gokena (7f); worth market check on debut.

column4: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Winner Receives Free Entry To 2026 St Leger) (GBB/GBBPlus)

column36: Expensive yearling and has a classy middle-distance pedigree; another interesting newcomer
column37: 425,000gns yearling; Wootton Bassett half-brother to 9.4f winner Iseult Of Ireland (RPR 91); dam 1m4f winner (73), sister to Breeders' Cup Turf and Arc winner Found; was an expensive yearling and has a classy middle-distance pedigree; another newcomer with claims on paper.

column36: 150,000gns yearling; half-brother to a 5f Listed winner; not ruled out on debut
column37: 150,000gns yearling, by St Mark's Basilica; half-brother to 5f-7.6f winner Mutaraffa (including Listed; RPR 111); dam placed in France, sister to 7f 2yo winner Grizzle, out of 6f 2yo Listed winner; not ruled out on debut.

column36: Half-brother to a French Group-placed 1m2f 2yo winner; market support would be significant
column37: Galiway half-brother to French Group-placed 1m2f 2yo winner Zarakchic (RPR 96); dam unraced sister to 7.5f-1m1f winner Parigi, out of 12.5f Listed winner; in good hands and market support would be significant on debut.

column36: 50,000gns yearling; already gelded and would be a surprise first-time-out winner
column37: 50,000gns yearling; brother to 7f/1m winner Rocchigiani (including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 111), half-brother to five winners including Ross (6.5f-7.5f including French Listed; 111); dam German 1m Listed winner (101); already gelded and would be a surprise first-time-out winner.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Smart at his best but not at best this year; bounce-back needed after three-month break
column37: Smart at his peak but has not run to his best this year, only eighth when favourite for a handicap at Epsom on Oaks day; first-time cheekpieces worn on that occasion are left off here; returns from three-month break with his yard in form.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Listed win on heavy at 2 but hasn't reached the same heights in similar races this year
column37: Smart effort when 4l winner of a 1m1f French Listed race in the mud on his final 2yo start; left Chester Vase reappearance behind when 1.25l fifth in 1m3f Hamilton Listed event (good) in July but ran poorly in another Listed race back in France since; no shock were he to revive, particularly if the ground gets testing, but others arrive with less to prove.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Largely progressive; better than result (met trouble) on AW latest; respected
column37: Bar a blip on fast ground at York in June his profile is essentially progressive, including clear second to a next-time-out winner at Newbury (1m2f, good) in May; shaped much better than result when never-nearer sixth of ten at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) last time, left with too much to do after meeting trouble early in the home straight; could still be on a good mark.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column27: New England Stud & Mount Coote Stud
column36: Seems best on soft/heavy and not discounted should such conditions prevail
column37: Soft or heavy ground dominate among her best performances, which she's had this term only when a creditable third at Chester (1m2f) in June; well held at Glorious Goodwood since; each-way claims should more rain arrive.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Has shown he retains his ability but slow starts in danger of becoming an issue
column37: Usually held up; last three wins over 1m2f at Newbury (the latest a valuable event on heavy off 3lb lower last September) but also successful over C&D (soft) at the start of his career; has shown more than enough to think he retains his ability in three outings this year but could do with cutting out the slow starts.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Good thirds on AW/turf this summer and a slow start didn't help latest; Oisin Murphy up
column37: In top form when racking up a hat-trick last summer and back at that level when third over 1m2f at Newcastle (AW) and Chepstow (good to soft) this summer; never a threat after a slow start at Southwell last time but more than capable off this mark and Oisin Murphy takes the reins.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column32: Mrs M Lingwood And S Bland
column36: Prominent racer; two more Ripon wins this year but held off this mark last twice
column37: Gained fourth Ripon success when making all over 1m2f (soft) in July; 4l second at Chester (1m2f, good) next time and perhaps a drop back to 1m didn't suit when only sixth of seven back at Ripon 19 days ago.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Unexposed handicap newcomer who should stay 1m2f; has to enter calculations
column37: Looked a useful prospect when successful on his belated debut at Thirsk (1m, good) in July; a Glorious Goodwood conditions event proved beyond him next time but clear second behind a very useful sort in a novice at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm) since; unexposed now venturing into his first handicap over a trip which should be within range.

column4: Mastiff Manor Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
column19: Regalian is feared with his yard in excellent form but preference is for SOVEREIGN SEA (nap).
column20: 7/2 Botanical,  Sovereign Sea, 6/1 Regalian, 7/1 Divine Knight, 8/1 Fantasy Believer,  Sportingsilvermine, 10/1 Mustazeed, 12/1 Square d'Alboni,  Our Golden One, 14/1 Ey Up Its The Boss
column36: Progress seems to have levelled off but the drop to 1m2f may help; acts on soft
column37: Won over 1m3f and 1m4f in the spring on first two starts for James Owen; his progress has levelled off since but the way he swept into contention when third at Hamilton (1m4f, good to firm) three weeks ago suggests this drop to 1m2f for the first time since joining this yard could suit this sometimes free goer; acts on soft.

column37: Unexposed after just four runs; looked green as a 2yo and appeared a much improved model when third of eight over C&D (good ground) 18 days ago, fading after eight months off; the hood (omitted on return) goes back on today; in good hands and has far more potential than most of today's rivals.

column37: Most recent win came at 50-1 over C&D last summer; second here last month but only fifth on most recent start when behind Sixcor, Crackinthunder and Ski Angel.

column37: Won a barrier trial at Naas in May; put that experience to good use when landing a C&D maiden on soft; twice fourth in small-field Group races won by the Aidan O'Brien-trained Composing; ground not an issue, but limitations have been exposed.

column37: Did well to overcome inexperience to make a winning debut in a fillies' maiden at Naas late last month; well-regarded and might not be out of place in this company despite the relatively short gap between races.

column32: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg
column36: Defied market weakness to win on her debut, superb pedigree, potentially very smart
column37: St Mark's Basilica filly cost E1,700,000euros as a yearling; half-sister to eight winners, including Magic Wand (Ribblesdale and Australian Group 1), and Chicquita (Irish Oaks); made a pleasing debut when beating stablemate and favourite Minerva at the Curragh; an element of doubt is introduced by Minerva's eclipse behind Kensington Lane at Gowran.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column36: The only filly in the field with no previous experience, huge task in the circumstances
column37: sixth foal; half-sister to two winners; dam 1m2f winner; half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner James Garfield; the only filly in the field with no previous experience; huge task in the circumstances.

column37: Has improved with experience; was having her third outing when second to the subsequent Ballyhane Stakes runner-up at Down Royal; made most before being overhauled late by subsequent Group 2 runner-up Geryon at the Curragh; relegated the disappointing Minerva to fourth when winning readily at Gowran.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column36: Slowly away before running on to some effect on debut over C&D, takes a big jump in class
column37: Slowly away before running on to some effect into fourth on debut over C&D last month; form took a knock with the defeat of runner-up Josh's Joy at Cork on Wednesday.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column36: Looked raw when winning first time out at Galway, the value of the form is questionable
column37: Looked raw first time at Galway and deserves plenty of credit for getting the better of the twice-raced runner-up; has the makings of a long-term prospect, but the form is of questionable value at this level, since the second was a beaten favourite from a mark of 79 in a Killarney nursery on her next start.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column36: Struggled in a C&D Group 3 in July, in receipt of 8lb when second at Roscommon, tough task
column37: Bellewstown maiden winner over 1m, rated 87 after four runs; finished last of five behind Composing in a C&D Group 3 in July; more like it when second at Roscommon, though she was getting 8lb from the winner.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column36: Fair fourth behind an Aidan O'Brien-trained winner at Goodwood, yet to race on soft
column37: Overcame trouble to win on debut over 6f on good to firm at Newbury in June; never-dangerous seventh when an outsider 6f Ascot Group 3; got closer when fourth of seven behind the Aidan O'Brien-trained Precise in a 7f Group 3 at Goodwood.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column37: Bigger price of her trainer's pair on debut at Fairyhouse; shaped with some promise and built on that when a clear second at this venue; only workmanlike when landing short odds at Lingfield; takes a big jump in class with a tongue-tie fitted.

column4: Ballylinch Stud Irish EBF Ingabelle Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)

column32: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
column36: No sign that she can match the ability shown by stablemate Diamond Necklace
column37: Apprentice-ridden second string first time out over 1m here in July; second and third have let the form down, and she failed to improve when unplaced over C&D on second start; no sign that she can match the ability shown by stablemate Diamond Necklace.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)

column37: Down the field in this race last year off 95 but ended campaign with fine win over this trip at Naas (yielding) and eyecatching comeback run last month after 306-day absence, staying on well from off the pace when beaten only 0.5l in fourth in Cork Listed; career-high mark but rider claims 7lb; wide draw not ideal but top-weight respected.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)
column19: Johnny Murtagh holds a strong hand, CHICAGO FIREBALL narrowly preferred to the top-weighted Rahmi
column20: 11/2 Gleneagle Bay, 13/2 Rahmi, 15/2 Dunum,  Chicago Fireball, 8/1 Dance Night Andday, 10/1 Hurricane Ivor, 12/1 One Smack Mac,  Slieve Binnian,  Tribal Nation,  Pier Pressure,  Nakasero, 14/1 Blues Emperor,  Glenfinnan, 16/1 I Am Superman, 20/1 Daamberdiplomat, 25/1 Noble Truth
column36: Last year's second races off 6lb higher here but remains on the shortlist
column37: Won three handicaps last season including this event off 93 (beating Gleneagle Bay a head); career-best when beaten a neck in Group 3 Brownstown Stakes over C&D in July, well below best when dropped in trip latest; one to consider.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)
column19: Johnny Murtagh holds a strong hand, CHICAGO FIREBALL narrowly preferred to the top-weighted Rahmi
column20: 11/2 Gleneagle Bay, 13/2 Rahmi, 15/2 Dunum,  Chicago Fireball, 8/1 Dance Night Andday, 10/1 Hurricane Ivor, 12/1 One Smack Mac,  Slieve Binnian,  Tribal Nation,  Pier Pressure,  Nakasero, 14/1 Blues Emperor,  Glenfinnan, 16/1 I Am Superman, 20/1 Daamberdiplomat, 25/1 Noble Truth
column36: Second in this race 2 years ago off 101 and in top form at Galway recently; draw not ideal
column37: Great money-spinner for connections and especially effective at Galway, winning for the third time there when landing Colm Quinn Mile in July under well-judged front-running ride; fine effort under 7lb penalty five days later at same venue when third in Ahonoora Handicap back at 7f; second in this race two years ago off 101 so major respect although draw hasn't been kind.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)
column19: Johnny Murtagh holds a strong hand, CHICAGO FIREBALL narrowly preferred to the top-weighted Rahmi

column36: Gelded since finishing last in Group 3 Jersey Stakes, not to be dismissed on handicap bow
column37: Debut winner last year of Naas maiden but hasn't added to tally in six starts since, standout effort when second in Naas Listed over this trip in May; gelded since finishing last in Group 3 Jersey Stakes in June and not to be dismissed on handicap debut though stiff enough task at the weights.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)

column37: Lightly raced 5yo with just an AW maiden win but knocking on the door in valuable handicaps, notably beaten a head in this race last year (by Dance Night Andday) and last month only worn down late in Ahonoora Handicap at Galway (Dunum third) on soft; good draw and seems sure to be thereabouts.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)

column37: Fine stalwart has won eight races, including seasonal return at Naas in March (7f, soft-to-heavy); below best of late but reduced mark now and soft ground so could improve on recent form.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)
column19: Johnny Murtagh holds a strong hand, CHICAGO FIREBALL narrowly preferred to the top-weighted Rahmi

column36: Progressive this year over longer trips; drop back to 7f may not suit
column37: Has progressed really well since joining this yard this term, recording back-to-back premier handicap wins at the Curragh and when hitting the line strongly here over 1m1f on quick ground; keen and never involved from a wide draw behind Dunum at Galway on latest; drop back to 7f may not suit.

column36: Sixth in this race last year off 90; recent form doesn't inspire confidence
column37: Sixth in this race last year off 90; brief return to form when winning at Fairyhouse in July but safely held twice since in better-class premier handicaps; others preferred.

column37: Two 1m wins last year (including on heavy) and back to form after a short break to win at Gowran last month under a positive ride from today's rider (7f, good); 5lb rise seems fair, could go well.

column37: Landed the Jersey Stakes at Royal Ascot in 2022 for Charlie Appleby; nearer last than first in all five starts since, including twice in big Ascot handicaps this summer; much reduced mark but impossible to have faith in.

column32: Teme Valley & Newsells Park Stud Ltd
column36: Gelded since Killarney flop; bit to prove and draw not great
column37: Won his maiden on heavy but handled faster ground when sixth of 30 in the Britannia at Royal Ascot; keen and didn't get home (lost shoe) over a mile at Killarney when long odds-on last time and gelded since; bit to prove and draw not great.

column37: Age likely catching up with the dual Group 2 winner but seasonal-best when close fourth to Slieve Binnian at the Curragh in June; back from a short break when didn't count but not beaten far at same venue last month; handicapper giving him a chance but remains vulnerable to more progressive types.

column37: Both turf wins have come at Gowran, most recently last month over 1m off 80, having previously gone close here over same trip under regular rider; 4lb rise okay but draw is a negative and soft ground a concern.

column36: Four wins all on quicker ground; regressive this year but mildly  encouraging last time
column37: Four wins all on much quicker ground; regressive this year although mildly more encouraging effort last time at Sandown (soft); 1lb wrong; opposable.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)
column19: Johnny Murtagh holds a strong hand, CHICAGO FIREBALL narrowly preferred to the top-weighted Rahmi

column36: Recent 1m1f winner here; up 8lb but still races from 3lb out of handicap here
column37: Back to form to record first win win for the yard when scoring here over 1m1f last month, making most under 10lb claimer on good ground; 8lb rise for that but still races from 3lb out of handicap here.

column4: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
column19: All five trained by the O'Briens, with BENVENUTO CELLINI taken to repel stablemate Montreal
column20: 5/4 Benvenuto Cellini, 2/1 Montreal, 11/2 Hardy Warrior, 13/2 A Boy Named Susie, 25/1 Nil Bua Gan Dua
column36: Impressed at Killarney on soft; trip/ground may not have suited latest; don't rule out
column37: Starspangledbanner half-brother to winners Seagolazo (7f 2yo; RPR 97) and Zephina (6f AW 2yo; 76); unraced dam is out of half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Mehmas; made fine impression on Killarney debut, quickening well off a steady pace in 1m auction event on soft ground, didn't progress as much as expected in Group 2 Futurity at the Curragh, keen enough and outpaced over shorter trip when beaten 7l on good; return to 1m and softer ground could see improvement.

column4: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
column19: All five trained by the O'Briens, with BENVENUTO CELLINI taken to repel stablemate Montreal
column20: 5/4 Benvenuto Cellini, 2/1 Montreal, 11/2 Hardy Warrior, 13/2 A Boy Named Susie, 25/1 Nil Bua Gan Dua
column36: Ready Killarney winner over this trip and on similar ground; major chance
column37: Frankel brother to this year's Lingfield Oaks Trial winner Giselle; loads of debut promise at the Curragh in June and confirmed that when landing long odds over today's trip at Killarney following month, making all in readily beating a stablemate and subsequent maiden winner on yielding-to-soft, still green; very smart prospect, major player here with conditions to suit.

column4: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
column19: All five trained by the O'Briens, with BENVENUTO CELLINI taken to repel stablemate Montreal
column20: 5/4 Benvenuto Cellini, 2/1 Montreal, 11/2 Hardy Warrior, 13/2 A Boy Named Susie, 25/1 Nil Bua Gan Dua
column36: C&D winner last time on similar ground; held by Benvenuto Cellini previously
column37: Pinatubo colt is half-brother to winners Tamrat (1m inc 2yo/UAE; RPR 96) and Yamal (1m 2yo; 88); dam Listed-placed 10.6f AW winner (96), half-sister to Group 1 winner Youmzain; backed up promising debut fourth to today's rival Benvenuto Cellini at Killarney by making all over C&D in late July on yielding-to-soft; interesting rematch here and McMonagle's pick.

column4: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
column19: All five trained by the O'Briens, with BENVENUTO CELLINI taken to repel stablemate Montreal
column20: 5/4 Benvenuto Cellini, 2/1 Montreal, 11/2 Hardy Warrior, 13/2 A Boy Named Susie, 25/1 Nil Bua Gan Dua
column36: Runaway C&D maiden winner last month, third to Hardy Warrior previously in similar contest
column37: Sea The Stars colt is closely related to 1m4f winner (RPR 91)  Ephesus and half-brother to six winners inc Cayenne Pepper (7f-1m2f inc 2yo/Group 2; 114); dam 7f AW 2yo winner; missed the break on debut when a staying on third (beaten 6.25l) to Hardy Warrior over C&D in July and fortnight later made all to run away with similar contest on better ground; type to keep improving and interestingly the pick of Soumillon.

column4: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
column19: All five trained by the O'Briens, with BENVENUTO CELLINI taken to repel stablemate Montreal

column32: A K Whelan & Reeves Thoroughbred Racing
column36: Not sure this sort of stamina test is what he wants at this stage
column37: American Pharoah colt cost $38,000 as a yearling and 160,000euros at the breeze-ups; first foal; dam placed US 1m-1m1f turf/AW, half-sister to US 1m Grade 3 winner Keri Belle; plenty of speed on debut last month, fading late into fourth over 7f at the Curragh; plenty more needed and not sure this sort of stamina test is what he wants at this stage.

column4: CMG Group Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Last year's winner Trustyourinstinct is respected but AL AASY (nap) looks a tough nut to crack

column36: 8 wins at Group 3 level, as good as ever at Goodwood recently; the one to beat
column37: 8yo finished second in this race two years ago and better form in recent years, now a winner of eight races at Group 3 level, including this term at Sandown (1m2f) and most recently last month's Glorious Goodwood Stakes, producing a tidy turn of foot in softish ground to win it for second consecutive year; sets a high standard.

column4: CMG Group Stakes (Group 3)
column19: Last year's winner Trustyourinstinct is respected but AL AASY (nap) looks a tough nut to crack

column36: Dictated to win Ballyroan over C&D last month; won't have it so easy here
column37: Several decent efforts in defeat at Listed/Group 3 level for Jane Chapple-Hyam in 2024 and again earlier this term before making the breakthrough at this level in Ballyroan Stakes over C&D last month, dictating throughout on first attempt at this trip; stiffer task here.

column19: Last year's winner Trustyourinstinct is respected but AL AASY (nap) looks a tough nut to crack

column36: Thriving of late but faces a different class of opponent here in Al Aaasy
column37: Last year's winner (good) has proven better again this term, winning latest two starts at the Curragh; won Listed event over this trip, going away, and 1m2f Group 3 International Stakes again never stronger than at finish; thriving with his racing but faces a different class of opponent here in Al Aaasy and softer ground may not be ideal.

column4: CMG Group Stakes (Group 3)

column36: Progressed into smart 1m4f handicapper but upped in grade now and much more needed
column37: Progressive handicapper this year, winning premier handicap over C&D in June and won at Gowran last month over same trip; well-backed but didn't seem to stay (keen) in 1m6f Ebor on latest when cheekpieces tried (now left off); upped in grade here and needs to improve.

column36: Ground now in his favour but faces stronger stayers at this trip
column37: Loves soft/heavy ground, dual 1m12f Naas Listed winner from three Flat wins; down the field in Galway Hurdle when last seen (ground too quick) and has had a short break since; ground now in his favour but faces stronger stayers at this trip.

column37: Decent sort but hasn't added to 2yo maiden win; placed on five of six starts this term, including C&D Listed, most recently in Galway premier handicap; fair bit to find to play a major role.

column4: CMG Group Stakes (Group 3)

column37: Lightly raced 3yo won a couple of novice events at Redcar (including on soft) before third in hot Group 3 Chester Vase (1m4f, good); better again in 17-runner Group 1 Deutsches Derby on latest, only touched off final stride after racing prominently; very interesting contender now taking on his elders.

column36: Return to this trip to suit but career-best needed to get in in the mix
column37: Improving 3yo's best run came in winning valuable Goodwood handicap over this trip in July (good); unable to get competitive back at 1m2f (soft) in very valuable Deauville sales race from a wide draw; return to this trip to suit but career-best needed to get in in the mix.

column37: Navan maiden win came on soft and most recently career-best albeit beaten odds-on favourite when second in Naas handicap over 1m2f (good); first attempt at 1m4f and hood tried.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record
column20: 15/8 January, 2/1 Fallen Angel, 9/2 Cercene, 12/1 Vera's Secret,  Cathedral, 14/1 Exactly, 16/1 Atsila, 20/1 Sparks Fly, 25/1 California Dreamer, 33/1 Queen Of Thunder, 100/1 Duckadilly
column36: Fourth behind Vera's Secret in a Group 3 event and Listed-placed, an unenviable task here
column37: Won 1m Naas maiden on only start at three; has confirmed a fair standard form this year; however, this is very ambitious following her 6l fourth behind Vera's Secret in a 7f Group 3 event here in June and Listed second at Killarney last month.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record

column36: Established star, second in this 12 months ago, can confirm Deauville form with January
column37: Last year's Irish 1,000 Guineas winner; led at a steady pace before losing out to Porta Fortuna in this event last year; not beaten far in fourth on testing ground in the Opera; stepped up on reappearance form when third in the Duke of Cambridge (first-time cheekpieces); produced a resolute display to beat January in the Prix Rothschild at Deauville; an established Group 1 star.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record

column36: Went very close in a recent Group 3 event at Tipperary, unlikely to feature at this level
column37: Seventh of 13 behind Fallen Angel in last year's Irish 1,000 Guineas; back from long absence to win 1m Killarney maiden in May; ran her best race of the season when a short head second in a Group 3 event over a little shorter than this at Tipperary 13 days ago.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record

column36: Four-time Listed winner in Britain and France, most effective in very testing conditions
column37: Excellent strike-rate on ground softer than good, notching four Listed wins over 1m in Britain and France; below best on seasonal debut in France in March. shaped well in Group 3 at Epsom in June, finishing nicely after meeting trouble in running.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record
column20: 15/8 January, 2/1 Fallen Angel, 9/2 Cercene, 12/1 Vera's Secret,  Cathedral, 14/1 Exactly, 16/1 Atsila, 20/1 Sparks Fly, 25/1 California Dreamer, 33/1 Queen Of Thunder, 100/1 Duckadilly
column36: Group 2 second behind Porta Fortuna before 7f Group 3 course win, smart late-maturing mare
column37: Late-starter but rapid improver in handicaps last year and has stepped up again this year, making all for 4l win in a 7f  fillies' Group 3 at this venue in May; found life tougher a fortnight later in Group 2 Lanwades Stud Stakes at the Curragh over a mile, solid run when 3l  behind the high-class Porta Fortuna; made all to win 7f Group 3 here two months ago.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record

column32: B Fowler/Medallion Racing '20/S Weston/Reeves T'bred Racing
column36: Out of the money in three Group 1 attempts since beating Cercene at the Curragh in May
column37: Unraced at two; beat the subsequent Coronation Stakes winner Cercene in a Group 3 at the Curragh on second start; has run in three Group 1s since then, seventh in the Irish 1,000 Guineas, sixth in the Falmouth; eighth behind Fallen Angel in the Prix Rothschild.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)

column32: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
column36: Irish 1,000 Guineas runner-up, has failed to match that form in three more recent outings
column37: Sole win came at very short odds in 1m AW maiden in February; has run some excellent races in defeat in Group company, notably when 50-1 second to Lake Victoria in Irish 1,000 Guineas; flopped in the Jersey Stakes and has failed to recover her form in two subsequent outings, the latest over 6f.

column36: Fourth behind Cercene in the Coronation Stakes, good run on soft in a Group 3 last time
column37: Smart effort when fourth behind Cercene in the Coronation Stakes at Royal Ascot (1m, good to firm) before filling the runner-up spot at Group 3 level for a second time when going down by 2 1/2l at Chantilly (1m1f, soft) on final start for Ralph Beckett.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record

column36: Third in Irish 1,000 Guineas, shock winner of Coronation Stakes, solid run in the Nassau
column37: Third in the Irish 1,000 Guineas, 1 3/4l off runner-up California Dreamer; sprang 33-1 success surprise in the Coronation Stakes at Royal Ascot; no match for the front-running Whirl when stepped up 1m2f in the Nassau; coped well considering she was the outsider of five and running on ground that contrasted sharply with the quick surface she enjoyed at Royal Ascot.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record

column32: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
column36: Sixth in the Coronation, fifth behind Fallen Angel in the Prix Rothschild, up against it
column37: Won 7f 2yo Group 3 here last October and started the new season with a 7f Group 3 second here; has come up short in four Group 1 outings since then, including sixth behind Cercene in the Coronation and fifth behind Fallen Angel in the Prix Rothschild.

column4: Coolmore America 'Justify' Matron Stakes (Group 1) (Fillies & Mares)
column19: Already twice a Group 1 winner in Ireland and second to Porta Fortuna here 12 months ago, FALLEN ANGEL can enhance her fine record
column20: 15/8 January, 2/1 Fallen Angel, 9/2 Cercene, 12/1 Vera's Secret,  Cathedral, 14/1 Exactly, 16/1 Atsila, 20/1 Sparks Fly, 25/1 California Dreamer, 33/1 Queen Of Thunder, 100/1 Duckadilly
column32: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
column36: Placed four times in Group 1 races, closely matched with Fallen Angel on Deauville run
column37: Ended last season with second to Desert Flower in the Fillies' Mile; well beaten in the Irish 1,000 Guineas on reappearance; showed that to be all wrong when third to Cercene in the Coronation and runner-up in the Falmouth; best effort yet when making Fallen Angel pull out all the stops in the Prix Rothschild.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger
column20: 3/1 Skukuza, 9/2 Alakazi, 11/2 Johan, 13/2 Chicago Critic, 7/1 Comanche Brave, 9/1 Expanded,  Scorthy Champ, 12/1 Mutasarref, 14/1 Lord Massusus, 16/1 Copacabana Sands
column36: Third to Johan in C&D Desmond Stakes; likely stronger pace to suit but this a deeper race
column37: Career-best when winning C&D Listed Amethyst Stakes in May (good), coming from well off pace; similar tactics employed in Group Desmond Stakes over C&D last month but left with too much to do when strong-finishing 1l third to front-running Johan; likely stronger pace here should suit but this looks a deeper race.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column36: All-the-way C&D Desmond Stakes win last month; acts on soft, could go well
column37: Interrupted career but has a good strike rate, including high-profile handicap wins at Goodwood and twice at Doncaster including a year ago; first Group win came under canny front-running ride over C&D last month in Desmond Stakes (accounted for four of thesse rivals) on belated seasonal return; unlikely to get such a soft lead here but handles soft and could go well.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column36: Dual C&D winner including Listed in April; has to improve on recent form though
column37: Has gained two of his seven wins over C&D, Group 3 Desmond Stakes in 2023 and more recently beating Mutasarref a neck in Listed contest in April; hasn't matched that form since however and looks to have a bit to find, especially as the balance of form is on better ground.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column36: Loves it around here but not at his best this year and will do well to make the frame
column37: Ten victories include four here, notably twice at Group 3 level last year; not quite at same level this year but solid form, most recently fourth to Johan when attempting repeat Desmond Stakes win last month; admirable 7yo but will do well to make the frame.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column36: Progressive 4yo a major player if handling the ground conditions
column37: Progressive 4yo won over this trip at the Curragh this term in premier handicap and Listed contest (beating Alakazi); similar level of form unlucky-in-running third in Group 2 Strensall Stakes at York last month; below-par run on soft ground in between raises concerns but big player if handling it.

column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column36: Improving 3yo will appreciate a strong pace, unproven on soft
column37: Lightly raced 3yo won C&D maiden in April and coped well with rise in class when second to Skukuza in Curragh Listed and staying on second to front-running Johan in Group 3 Desmond Stakes over C&D last month; gives impression a more strongly-run 1m will suit, unproven on ground this soft.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column32: Mrs John Magnier & Mrs A M O'Brien
column36: Highly tried 3yo a contender on best form although soft ground may not suit
column37: Cork maiden winner last year and was gaining first win since when landing odds in minor Naas conditions event in July; highly tried at times, including smart form in both 2000 Guineas Trial over C&D and when beaten 5.5l in Irish 2000 Guineas; has been withdrawn due to soft ground before so ground unlikely to suit here.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
column19: Despite concerns over the ground it could pay to side with SKUKUZA after a luckless York run, Alakazi looking a danger

column36: Guineas' flop has been waiting for soft ground so potential improver
column37: Last year's Group 1 Dewhurst runner-up (soft) ran way below that level in both Guineas' in the spring on better ground, fading after showing up early at Newmarket and even worse at the Curragh, always behind after a slow start; missed two engagements since due to ground but has it in his favour here so return to form conceivable.

column4: Tonybet Solonaway Stakes (Group 2)
